moves.1. c4 c5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. e3 e6 4. Nc3 Nf6: In almost any endgame, it is a significant advantage to have the more active king, and this is a perfect illustration of that rule applying in a bishop endgame. Black has two weak pawns on a6 and c6, to the defence of which his bishop will be tied down. Meanwhile White will penetrate with his king on the weakened light squares on the kingside (two weaknesses!}. It seems unlikely that he should be able to do so, but with the aid of zugzwang, his king makes it all the way to h8. Finally, we see another typical device in minor piece endings - the sacrifice of a piece, to net a winning collection of pawns. Averbakh's handling of the endgame is technically flawless.
moves.49. g4: Fixing weaknesses - now the enemy kingside pawns are fixed in their place, and White can prepare to infiltrate them with his king.
moves.49... Kd6 50. Kf2 Ke7 51. Kg3 Kf8 52. Kh: Tying the black bishop down to the defence of a6.
moves.54... Kf7 55. h3: Zugzwang. Now Black's king must give way, since 55. ...Bb7 results in his bishop being completely immobilized after 56. Bf5.
moves.57... Kf8 58. Be2 Kg8 59. Bd3: Once again, Black is in zugzwang and must give ground.
moves.59... Kf8 60. Kh7 Kf7 61. Bg6+ Kf8 62. K: White's king has made it to the end of the earth. Now the next stage is to force Black to undefend the pawn on g7.
moves.65... Bc8 66. Be8: A beautifully elegant final blow. The bishop sacrifices itself, on an empty square (always the most aesthetic form of sacrifice), in order to destroy the black kingside pawn structure.
moves.66... Kxe8 67. Kxg7 h5: Desperation. If 67. ...Ke7 68. h4! (not 68 Kxh6?? Kf7 with a draw) 68. ...Bd7 and now simply 69. g5! and the f-pawn will promote.
moves.74. Kf5 Kg8 75. g7 Bf7 76. Ke5 Bg6 77. K: If the bishop stays on the a6-f1 diagonal, to prevent White's next, then after 79 ...Bc4 White wins by 80. g8Q+! Kxg8 81. Ke7.
moves.80. b5:
Now the a-pawn will decide. A beautifully elegant ending by the great Soviet endgame expert, and a highly
instructive demonstration of some typical endgame ideas.
